means: 好礼仪的，讲究礼节的，正式的

sentence.Network_en: Putting on a hat can be a ceremonious act, an elegant gesture in the ritual of dressing.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴帽子被看作一种礼节性的举动, 是着装仪式上一个优雅的举动.

sentence.Network_en: He unveiled the picture with a ceremonious gesture.
sentence.Network_cn: 他郑重其事地为这幅画揭幕.

sentence.Network_en: Such a ceremonious opening, but it had nothing practical in it.
sentence.Network_cn: 把剪彩仪式搞得这么隆重, 纯粹是摆花架子.

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent.: from French cérémonieux or late Latin caerimoniosus, from  caerimonia (see ceremony)

sentences.sentence: "their ceremonious greetings did not seem heartfelt"
